entry.title: Introduction
entry.summary: The context is a discussion thread from 2011 about building Bitcoin with autotools and using autoconf to simplify installation and testing processes. One member of the discussion suggests running Bitcoin in /etc/init.d on Debian-based systems, while another member criticizes the use of non-standard "init replacements" that go against Unix design. The conversation then shifts towards standard coding and implementation paradigms for abstracting Bitcoin components such as the node, wallet, and GUI. The discussion ends with one member expressing interest in checking out the proposed https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Wallet_protocol.
